title: J&J Distributing Recalls Ready-to-Eat Meat and Poultry Salads and Wrap Products Due to Possible Listeria Contamination
summary: J&J Distributing, a St. Paul, Minn., establishment, is recalling approximately 33 pounds of ready-to-eat meat and poultry salads and wrap products that may be adulterated with Listeria monocytogenes (Lm), the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The fully cooked...
impacted_products: 9-oz. plastic container of “COBB SALAD” on the product label.
10-oz. plastic container of “Because life is delicious. tastebuds Bacon Lettuce Avocado Tomato Wrap” on the label.
10-oz. plastic container of “Because life is delicious. tastebuds Turkey Ranch Club Wrap” on the label.
10-oz. plastic container of “Because life is delicious. tastebuds Chicken Caesar Wrap” on the label.
12-oz. plastic container of “Because life is delicious. tastebuds Southwest Style Chicken Salad” on the label.
12-oz. plastic container of “Southwest Style Chicken Salad” on the label.
